---
title: "Daytime Observations"
format: 
  html:
    echo: false
    toc: true
editor: visual
---

::: {.cell}

:::


The following figures are limited to observations collected while on effort for transects. E.g. July 16, which revisited transect 15-16 is excluded.

## Overall summary

We observed 34 species of seabirds and marine mammals, totaling 11789 individuals.


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
|Species                      | Sightings| Total ind|
|:----------------------------|---------:|---------:|
|Common diving petrel         |       379|      5193|
|Antarctic fur seal           |        65|      1758|
|Cape petrel                  |       247|       964|
|Unknown giant petrel         |       276|       890|
|Blue petrel                  |       259|       567|
|Unknown diving petrel        |        67|       373|
|Southern giant petrel        |       167|       340|
|Kerguelen petrel             |       151|       327|
|South Georgia Cormorant      |        42|       318|
|Chinstrap penguin            |        16|       148|
|Northern giant petrel        |        94|       135|
|Wandering albatross          |        72|       100|
|Southern fulmar              |        60|        82|
|Snow petrel                  |        49|        82|
|Unknown petrel               |         5|        79|
|Antarctic petrel             |        43|        68|
|Antarctic tern               |        33|        66|
|Gentoo penguin               |        19|        58|
|Kelp gull                    |        10|        57|
|King penguin                 |        14|        39|
|Unknown prion                |        23|        24|
|Fairy prion                  |        19|        22|
|Humpback whale               |        10|        22|
|Unknown prion or blue petrel |        14|        16|
|Unknown penguin              |         9|        13|
|Unknown whale                |         8|        13|
|Southern right whale         |         4|        11|
|Black-browed albatross       |         8|        10|
|Hourglass dolphin            |         1|         8|
|Antarctic prion              |         3|         3|
|Orca                         |         1|         1|
|Unknown dolphin              |         1|         1|
|Unknown pinniped             |         1|         1|
:::
:::


## Species counts

Only species with 100+ individuals shown here.


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Daytime_files/figure-html/species_counts-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Species distributions

### Most common

Maps of the 6 most numerous taxa: diving petrels (CODP+UNDP), fur seals, giant petrels (NGPT+SGPT+UGPT), cape petrels, blue petrels, and Kerguelen petrels. Observations aggregated to 10 nm bins.


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Daytime_files/figure-html/species_maps-1.png){width=100%}
